entries.meaning: The first showing of a film, play or other form of entertainment, often held as a special event with celebrity guests.
The first episode of a television show or a particular season of that show.
In a series of narrative works, the installment that is chronologically set first.
The leading woman of a group, especially in a theatrical cast.

verbs.description: premiere (third-person singular simple present premieres, present participle premiering, simple past and past participle premiered)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) Of a film or play, to play for the first time.
examples: The new film premieres this weekend.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To present a film or play for the first time.
examples: The local theatre will premiere its latest play this week.
